sect1.para: Use the following command to list all available plug-ins, enabled and disabled. Use your server's hostname rather than the instance name of your 389 Directory Server, like the following example hostname of LDAPSERVER1:
sect1.screen:
>sudodsconf -D "cn=Directory Manager" ldap://LDAPSERVER1 plugin list Enter password for cn=Directory Manager on ldap://LDAPSERVER1: PASSWORD
7-bit check Account Policy Plugin Account Usability Plugin ACL Plugin ACL preoperation [...]
sect1.para: The following command enables the MemberOf plug-in referenced in . MemberOf simplifies user searches, by returning the user and any groups the user belongs to, with a single command. Without MemberOf, a client must run multiple lookups to find a user's group memberships.

screen.command: dsconf -D "cn=Directory Manager" ldap://LDAPSERVER1 plugin memberof enable

sect1.para: The plug-in names used in commands are lowercase, so they are different from how they appear when you list them. If you make a mistake with a plug-in name, you see a helpful error message:
sect1.screen: dsconf instance plugin: error: invalid choice: 'MemberOf' (choose from 'memberof', 'automember', 'referential-integrity', 'root-dn', 'usn', 'account-policy', 'attr-uniq', 'dna', 'linked-attr', 'managed-entries', 'pass-through-auth', 'retro-changelog', 'posix-winsync', 'contentsync', 'list', 'show', 'set')
sect1.para: After enabling a plug-in, it is necessary to restart the server:
Next, configure the plug-in. The following example enables MemberOf to search all entries. Use your instance name rather than the server's hostname:
sect1.screen: >sudodsconf LDAP1 plugin memberOf set --scope dc=example,dc=com Successfully changed the cn=MemberOf Plugin,cn=plugins,cn=config
sect1.para: After the MemberOf plug-in is enabled and configured, all new groups and users are automatically MemberOf targets. However, any users and groups that exist before it is enabled are not. They must be marked manually:
sect1.screen: >sudodsidm LDAP1 user modify suzanne add:objectclass:nsmemberof Successfully modified uid=suzanne,ou=people,dc=ldap1,dc=com
sect1.para: Now suzanne information and group membership are listed with a single command:
sect1.screen: >sudodsidm LDAP1 user get suzanne dn: uid=suzanne,ou=people,dc=ldap1,dc=com cn: suzanne displayName: Suzanne Geeko gidNumber: 102 homeDirectory: /home/suzanne memberOf: cn=SERVER_ADMINS,ou=groups,dc=ldap1,dc=com
sect1.para: Modifying a larger number of users is a lot of work. The following example shows how to make all legacy users MemberOf targets with one fixup command:

screen.command: dsconf LDAP1 plugin memberof fixup -f '(objectClass=*)' dc=LDAP1,dc=COM
